isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - TRANSMISSION SHIFT SELECTOR (53)

svcproc.title: TRANSMISSION SHIFT SELECTOR (53)
svcproc.para: The WT electronic shift selector is the microprocessor that communicates the driver input to the WT ECU. The transmission shift selector receives battery power 420-1 (circuit A136B) at all times (ignition key ON or OFF) from connection to start motor solenoid (circuit 329). The shift selector is grounded through connector (420-7) to GRD 1 located at the battery ground strap mounting bolt (circuit 323).

Shift selector connector (420) cavities 4, 5, 6 provide a communication path between the shift selector and the ECU. Circuits A168 (to 420-4) and A160 (to 420-5) are serial communication circuits and are wrapped together as a twisted pair of wires.
